channel.title: Homes on Maha Manai
channel.description: Recent content in Homes on Maha Manai

item.description: About me I am an applied microeconomist working on labor and behavioral economics. In my research, I apply a variety of advanced empirical methods using lab experiments, survey and administrative data to examine how individual behavior, decision making and heterogeneity shape different markets. My First paper is a natural experiment that uses survey data and a fuzzy differences-in-differences model to examine the health outcomes of a labor market policy aimed at the the unemployed during the Great Recession.

item.title: CV

item.title: Teaching
item.description: I am currently a teaching assistant for the following two courses: Public Finance (Fall Semester, Office hours on Tuesdays 2-4pm) Microeconomics (Spring Semester)
